items.text: full, outside off, and smashed through to the off side. But a solid stop from the cover fielder ensures it's only a couple
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Stirling, 2 runs

items.text: shott! Full, wide outside off, and Stirling takes a big stride forward before clattering a front-foot cover drive to the boundary
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Stirling, FOUR runs

items.text: full, on off, and tapped off the front foot to mid-off. The fielder intercepts
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Stirling, no run

items.text: full, outside off, and swinging away. Left alone by Stirling
items.postText: Niccolas Miller: "Been working on a BD eleven not including the big five and finding it rather hard, here's what I've come up with. 1. Soumya Sarkar 2. Liton Das (wk) 3. Imrul Kayes 4. Mohammed Mithun 5. Moseddek Hossain 6. Sabbir Rahman 7. Mehidy Hasan Miraz 8. Mohammed Saifuddin 9. Nazmul Islam 10. Mustafizur Rahman 11. Taskin Ahmed/Rubel Hossain Any suggestions?"
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Stirling, no run

items.text: length ball, angling in, and worked away to midwicket
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Stirling, 1 run

items.text: length ball, just outside off, and the attempted drive takes the bat's inside half and rolls away to the leg side. They scamper across for one
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Balbirnie, 1 run

items.text: full, just outside off, and pushed off the front foot to cover. No run
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Balbirnie, no run

items.text: slower ball, offcutter on off, and tapped off the back foot to mid-on. They race across for one
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Balbirnie, 1 run

items.text: another offcutter, wide outside off, and he hammers a cut-shot. Finds point though
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, no run

items.preText: Harry: "Wondering... What's the par score here? " -- Technically it's 210-ish, but in the recent past it's more towards 270-ish
items.text: appeal for lbw but turned down. Length ball on middle, and angling in. Hits his knee roll but would've gone down leg for sure
items.postText: abusayed: "A brain less BD team management" -- why would you say that? Surely it's all because of their bigger picture of the World Cup
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, no run

items.text: pulled in front of square! Expecting the short ball, and Rubel hands him that. Stays on the back foot, and hoicks it over the cow-corner boundary
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, SIX runs

items.text: full, just outside off, and he creams a cover drive. Misfield by cover allows them to hare back for the second
items.postText: Change in commentary. Here's Shashank Kishore for the first time today.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, 2 runs

items.text: nice and full on off, driven back but a good stop on his followthrough
items.postText: Baundele: "Taskin is the fastest pacer we have got. Unfortunately he has got fitness issues, which contributed to a dip in form. The media is putting pressure on the BCB to keep him in the world cup squad, and ridiculously, by replacing Abu Jayed. If that happens, nobody will win: half-fit Taskin will be under pressure; Abu Jayed will be demoralized; and the team will be unstable."
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Balbirnie, no run

items.text: shapes to drive but mistimes this back to the bowler
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Balbirnie, no run

items.text: picture-perfect drive on the up, straight to extra cover
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Balbirnie, no run

items.text: easy pickings! Strays onto the pads and he flicks behind square.
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Balbirnie, FOUR runs

items.text: huge appeal for lbw but this one comes back in to hit high on the pad. Going down
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Balbirnie, no run

items.text: touch ahead of length on off, defended
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Balbirnie, no run

items.text: incoming length ball from wide of the crease, defended back
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, no run

items.text: slower and fuller on off stump, defended with soft hands
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, no run

items.text: stands tall and punches this length ball to the edge of the ring at extra cover
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, no run

items.text: touch fuller, just around off, defended from the crease
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, no run

items.text: lucky to get away with a full delivery on the pads, defended gently to mid-on. Stopped short of playing a full-blooded flick
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, no run

items.text: slower and fuller on leg stump, defended
items.postText: Hey Baudele, here's Isam's reply regarding your point of view: "The only point of interest regarding Taskin came up when a reporter in Dublin kept spotting Abu Jayed not getting to bowl in the nets. Chief selector Minhajul Abedin told him that Jayed has a fitness issue, so he may not be considered during the tri-series. Jayed bowled in the nets in the two days before his ODI debut. In any case, Taskin/Jayed are not first choice members in the squad. It would take a little more to destabilize the Bangladesh team. Interestingly, Taskin's own Facebook page is carrying a "news" that he is going to be in the World Cup squad."
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Stirling, no run

items.text: flayed on the up through cover point! Sat up nicely, had width and Balbirnie said 'thank you very much'
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Balbirnie, FOUR runs
